unnormalised: Subsidy programs in India, like those supporting agriculture, are vital yet complex. Their effectiveness in reaching beneficiaries, particularly smallholder farmers in states like Bihar, requires rigorous evaluation. Leakages and distortions can undermine intended outcomes. Ensuring equitable distribution, especially during festivals like Onam when demand peaks, is paramount. Further research is needed to optimize targeting and minimize unintended consequences. Policy adjustments are crucial.
